item.title: Ronnie Lane
item.description: Ronald Frederick 'Ronnie' Lane was an English musician, songwriter, and producer who is best known as the bass guitarist and founding member of two prominent English rock and roll bands: Small Faces (1965–69) and subsequently Faces (1969–73). With Small Faces he was nicknamed 'Plonk'. After their breakup, reorganisation and Lane's losing the band's frontman slot to Rod Stewart, he earned the nickname 'Three-Piece'.

item.title: Steve Marriott
item.description: Stephen Peter Marriott was an English musician, songwriter and frontman of two notable rock and roll bands, spanning over two decades. Marriott is remembered for his powerful tenor singing voice which belied his small stature, and for his aggressive approach as a guitarist in mod rock bands Small Faces and Humble Pie. Marriott was inducted posthumously into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2012 as a member of Small Faces.
